conclusion: Analyze forces on object A and deformation of springs B and C.
Object A is at rest, mass of A is 2 kg, spring constant of B is 200 N/m, spring C is initially not deformed and horizontal.
Tension force of spring B equals gravitational force of A, right endpoint of spring C moved from position a to b, ab = 0.6 m.
Gravitational force on A is 19.6 N.
Tension in spring B equals gravitational force, spring B stretched by x1 = 0.098 m.
Height increase of A is equal to stretch of spring B, which is 0.098 m.
Horizontal displacement of right endpoint of spring C is 0.6 m.
Force exerted by spring C equals force exerted by spring B when A is in equilibrium, k2 x2 = 19.6 N.
Horizontal displacement of right endpoint of spring C is 0.6 m.
Deformation x2 is equal to horizontal displacement, x2 = 0.6 m.
Height that object A rises is 0.098 m, stiffness coefficient k2 of spring C is 32.67 N/m.
